creator: craigl@begeek.com
text:
i'm having a lot of trouble (and i'm not sure how i'm going to work around it
yet) configuring the proxied hosts into tomcat.  i find it confusing that the
Connector element defines the proxyHost and proxyPort attributes, when the
<Host> element is the place that the actual hostname being handled is named.  to
me at least, it makes a lot of sense to be able to define a proxy at the host
level, seeing as its that target host (exclusively) that the proxy is configured
for.

i'd like to see the ability to do this:

<Host name="server.tomcat.begeek.com"
      proxyHost="server.begeek.com"
      debug="0" appBase="webapps/server" >
...

any questions or comments welcome.

thanks.

creator: markt@apache.org
text: The name of the Host is used for proxyHost unless overridden on the connector.
